ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Without a doubt, I learned tremendously about what it is like to be an American envoy in such a complicated and evolving situation. Professor Feingold is clearly committed to his students, and it was an honor to learn from him.
This class gave me new perspectives on the great lakes region and what the role of the international community is. It was a great combination of academics and real world application.
Very nice insight and nuance into diplomacy and foreign policy making at the envoy level.

I gained a comprehensive knowledge base concerning the various conflict dynamics affecting the Great Lakes region, as well as experience in tracing the various diplomatic and broader political avenues used to address those conflicts

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I would say that I wish we would have engaged the readings more.

This course was great mix of professor led lecture, student presentations, and outside presentation. I think maybe more professor led student discussion could have been useful in the latter half of the course, but otherwise it was great.
This was one of the best seminars I've ever attended. The course had the perfect balance of discussion, group activity, lecture, and outside speaker presentation/interview.

The student led sections were great and brought fun and diverse ways of understanding content to the class. Feingold's comments were also a good addition. However, the course should try to go through the assigned readings and discuss them more. So that they feel useful to the discussion and even for reading them

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Best class I took at Yale ever!
Absolutely! Professor Feingold is a rock star, and an expert on such an understudied region.
Absolutely. It was a great combination of history, poli sci, international relations, and current affairs. It was a great class to understand how complicated history plays into current affairs.
Absolutely - great course and inspirational prof
